question: 踏む
sourceAnswer: to{} step-on/tread-on/trample-on | set-foot-on-(e.g.-foreign-soil)/stand-on/visit | experience/undergo | follow-(rules,-principles,-etc.)/go-through-(e.g.-formalities)/complete | estimate/guess/judge/value/appraise | rhyme | succeed-to-(e.g.-the-throne)
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>step</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to step on</vocabulary>. So, not quite "to step" like you might expect, but at least you're stepping still, though it's on something.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You want <vocabulary>to step on</vocabulary> that bug? You <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>)! That's a killer shoe stabbing bug, it will cut right through your sole and poison you via your foot! <reading>Foo</reading>l!
